title: Lynmar 2016 Block 10 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Slightly reductive, oaky and robust in tannin, this is a powerful expression of its particular site, planted to a mix of clones. Red cherry is pronounced along with a floral component of rose and earthy thread of crushed stone.

title: Quinta do Vale Meão 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: A perfumed wine, this has structure, fine tannins and a rich texture. It is full of black-currant and berry fruits as well as concentration and juicy acidity. This wine will develop gently and be ready to drink from 2027.

title: Quinta do Vallado 2016 Adelaide Vintage  (Port)
description: The wine is dominated by big bold tannins that give a sense of great power. That produces a wine with a strong structure, and a dry edge that will need to soften. Drink this dark firm wine from 2028.

title: Siduri 2016 Garys' Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: This is a heady, powerful and delicious wine from a famous vineyard by veteran winemaker Adam Lee. Plump red cherries, star anise and vanilla shine on the nose, leading into a beautifully full palate loaded with red currant, dark cherry and baking spice. The acid sings into the finish.

title: Trisaetum 2015 Family Reserve MMXV Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: A step beyond the Estates Reserve, this is even richer. Full-bodied flavors of plum, fig, cherry and chocolate come with a highlight of sea salt. It's supple and well knit, showing especially good concentration in this outstanding vintage. The structure for long-term aging is all in place. Drink now–2028.

title: V. Testulat NV Cuvée Prestige Brut  (Champagne)
description: Half and half Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, the top cuvée from this producer is well balanced and ripe, with a great contrast between the white fruits and the mineral texture. Flavors of stewed fruits and hints of apricots give character to this ripe, elegant wine. It is ready to drink.

title: Animo 2016 Heritage Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This is an exotic, 100% varietal wine given impressive time to mature before release. It's worth the wait. Flinty, it offers plenty of body around a wealth of well-developed pineapple, grapefruit and lemon-squeeze flavors, finishing in balance and with lingering complexity.

title: Antico Castello 2012  Taurasi
description: This opens with aromas of underbrush, scorched earth, spiced plum and balsamic. The juicy, delicious palate doles out fleshy black cherry, black raspberry, star anise and baking spice alongside polished tannins. It closes on a salty mineral note. It's structured and already enjoyable but will also offer fine sipping over the next few years. Drink through 2022.

title: Archery Summit 2015 Arcus Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: A captivating bouquet weaves together scents of breakfast tea, citrus and barrel. The flavors offer a glorious mix of lemon, yellow plum, pie cherry, chocolate, coffee grounds and black licorice. It's complex and detailed all the way through a lingering finish, with all these diverse components beautifully integrated. Drink now–2025.

title: Archery Summit 2015 Red Hills Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: Forward and fruit-driven, this offers lush aromas and a full-throttle dive into the depths of what has proven to be a truly outstanding vintage. Berries, pie cherries, ground coffee and cocoa combine in a lovely effort. It rolls along smooth and detailed into a lush and lingering finish.

title: Barra of Mendocino 2016 Estate Grown Petite Sirah (Mendocino)
description: Made from organic grapes, this wine has an impressively deep color that stays concentrated right to the dark-red rim. The nose brings violets, blueberries and black pepper, and the flavors gush dark fruit and dark chocolate, with hardly any oak influence. A surprisingly gentle layer of fine-grained tannins smooths the texture and soothes the palate. Best after 2023.

title: Bergström 2016 Winery Block Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
description: Bottled only in magnum in 2016, this was aged in a single French oak foudre. It was mostly whole clusters, hence stem-driven savory notes are abundant. There's a delicious mix of sassafras, sandalwood and cola threaded around strong black cherry fruit. Just a light whiff of compost adds further detail.

title: Bründlmayer NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Österreichischer Sekt)
description: Both fresh and baked red apple appear on the nose, alongside a very subtle, floral dimension. The palate is creamy and adds a rich, autolytic roundness to the fresh and lemony fruit. Subtle dosage lets these flavors shine and presents a wine that is slender, rich, subtle and elegant at the same time. The finish is lasting and lemony.

title: Colombo NV Silvì Metodo Classico Riserva Rosé (Alta Langa)
description: Strawberry, cherry, baking spice, bread crust, citrus and ginger aromas follow through to the fresh, creamy palate. A soft, silky mousse lends elegance.

title: Cristom 2016 Estate Chardonnay (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: This very limited production wine is barrel fermented and bottled unfiltered. Succulent flavors seamlessly blend sweet/tart Meyer lemon, peach pie and butterscotch. The wine is rich, ripe, creamy and long. Enjoy it now–2023.

title: Davies 2016 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This well-modulated, well-balanced and delicious wine has everything in place from the light baking-spice and red-cherry aromas to the black-cherry, raspberry and rhubarb flavors to the tangy and palate-cleansing mouthfeel. It's especially good for the “regular” Anderson Valley bottling.

title: De Ponte Cellars 2015 Baldwin Family Reserve Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: The top wine from De Ponte, this spent 14 months in 50% new French oak. The fruit is concentrated and delicious, a mix of ripe strawberries and cherries, and the satiny finish adds highlights of chocolate-covered orange peel. With ample aeration you may dive right in, or cellar a bit longer and drink from 2020 to 2030.

title: Domaine Serene 2015 Grace Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: Aromatic and complex, this nicely detailed release has benefited from a bit of extra bottle aging. Berry, cherry and plum flavors are well integrated, buoyed by supporting acidity and a mocha barrel tone. Drink now–2025.

title: Domaine Vacheron 2016 Les Romains  (Sancerre)
description: Opulent and rich, this wine offers intense, ripe yellow-fruit flavors and crisp citrus acidity that are enhanced by the concentrated texture. It is just now ready to drink but will age further, at least until 2022. Its name refers to the Romans who came to Sancerre.

title: Germano Ettore 2014 Prapò  (Barolo)
description: Forest floor, rose petal, wild herb and a balsamic whiff of eucalyptus lead the nose. The palate is elegant and structured, offering strawberry compote, crushed raspberry, cinnamon and star anise alongside polished tannins. A hint of crushed mint lingers on the finish while bright acidity lends balance. Drink 2021–2029.
